question_sentence: Pope Francis ended his Asia tour this week with a stop-off in which country?
evidence: The plane carrying the Vatican delegation touched down at Changi Airport on Wednesday afternoon. The 87-year-old pontiff's ambitious tour, which also included stops in Indonesia, Papua New Guinea and Timor-Leste, has widely been hailed as a success for interfaith relations. Find out more on this week's episode of The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: Two US citizens have been charged with running an online white supremacist terrorist group known as what?
evidence: Dallas Humber and Matthew Allison were indicted for leading the "Terrorgram Collective", an online group promoting attacks on public officials and infrastructure in support of violent white supremacist ideology. Both were arrested on charges including soliciting murder and providing material support to terrorists.

question_sentence: Which long-running British soap announced a time-jump that will see 20 characters written out to reduce costs?
evidence: Life in the fictional Chester suburb will leap forward by a year on Monday – minus one-third of the cast, who will be written out as part of cost-cutting measures. The Channel Four serial will also air three episodes a week, down from five.

question_sentence: The Phong Chau bridge in Vietnam collapsed due to which natural disaster?
evidence: Typhoon Yagi caused severe destruction in Vietnam, leaving at least 58 dead and hundreds missing. With wind speeds equivalent to a Category 3 hurricane, Yagi is said to be the worst typhoon in Vietnam in three decades.

question_sentence: Which EU technocrat unveiled a major report on how to stem Europe's economic decline?
evidence: The former president of the European Central Bank said Europe is "going to be a society that basically shrinks". His report looks at how a smaller Europe can remain competitive and maintain living standards.

question_sentence: Which rapper has been announced as the headliner for the 2025 Super Bowl half-time show?
evidence: The rapper will headline the Super Bowl LIX half-time show in New Orleans next February, bringing West Coast flair to the event. Lamar plans to showcase rap’s enduring influence, stating: "They got the right one."

question_sentence: A video released by the Princess of Wales to announce the end of her chemotherapy treatment shows her and her family in what setting?
evidence: In the three-minute clip, shot last month near the family's home in Norfolk, the Princess of Wales spoke of the "scary and unpredictable" experience of living with cancer, thanked the public for their support, and expressed her hope to return to royal duties over the coming months.

question_sentence: Which NFL player has complained after being dragged from his car and handcuffed by police during a traffic stop?
evidence: The Miami Dolphins' star wide receiver was detained by officers on the way to the Hard Rock Stadium for a home fixture against the Jacksonville Jaguars. The Miami-Dade Police Department has launched an investigation into the incident, and one officer involved "has been placed on administrative duties".

question_sentence: How did Taylor Swift sign off an Instagram post proclaiming her intention to vote for Kamala Harris?
choices: I knew Trump was trouble when he walked in
Look what you made me do
evidence: Swift's sign-off referenced dismissive comments about childless female voters made by Republican vice-presidential nominee J.D. Vance. Within hours of Swift's endorsement, there were well over 300,000 visits to the US government's voter registration page from the custom URL she shared with her 283 million Instagram followers.

question_sentence: How many passengers were aboard SpaceX's Crew Dragon capsule, who then completed the first ever civilian spacewalk?
evidence: The private space flight, chartered by tech billionaire Jared Isaacman , launched from Florida's Cape Canaveral, reaching a record altitude of 870 miles. Isaacman and engineer Sarah Gillis tested out SpaceX's own spacesuits as they completed the first-ever commercial spacewalk.

question_sentence: Which company attempted the first commercial spacewalk this week?
evidence: A four-person crew of civilians that embarked on a private mission aboard a SpaceX capsule conducted the world’s first commercial spacewalk. The Polaris Dawn mission also marks the farthest any human has journeyed since the final Apollo mission in 1972 — and the farthest into space a woman has traveled.

question_sentence: What is the name of the storm that battered Louisiana with flash flooding and damaging winds?
evidence: Francine made landfall in the New Orleans area as a Category 2 hurricane on Wednesday before weakening to a tropical storm. The names Kirk, Leslie and Milton will be used for future storms this year, according to the National Hurricane Center.

question_sentence: Which city hosted the high-stakes debate between Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump this week?
evidence: Tuesday night’s 90-minute matchup in Philadelphia drew an estimated 67.1 million viewers across 17 television networks, according to Nielsen data.

question_sentence: Legendary actor James Earl Jones died at 93 years old this week. Which of the original “Star Wars” characters did he voice?
evidence: With his remarkable voice, James Earl Jones brought power to all his stage and movie roles, most indelibly as Darth Vader in “Star Wars,” Mufasa in “The Lion King” and as the voice of CNN.

question_sentence: Which award show took place this week in New York City?
evidence: MTV’s Video Music Awards took place Wednesday in New York, where Taylor Swift won the event’s top prize for video of the year.

question_sentence: Which long-standing company announced it is changing its name?
evidence: After 155 years, the Campbell Soup Company is launching a rebrand. The famed red and white labels are here to stay, but its name will change slightly.

question_sentence: Two Delta Air Lines planes collided while taxiing for takeoff this week, knocking the tail section off one aircraft. Where did the incident occur?
evidence: Two Delta Air Lines planes collided as both taxied for takeoff at Atlanta’s busy Hartsfield-Jackson International Airport on Tuesday. No passengers were injured in the collision but the tail of one of the aircraft separated from the rest of the airplane.

question_sentence: Which type of juice sold at chain retailers across the US has been recalled over concerns about arsenic levels?
evidence: Bottles of apple juice sold under various brands at Walgreens, Walmart, BJ’s, Weis and Aldi have been recalled over concerns about arsenic levels.

question_sentence: Raging wildfires strained firefighting resources this week in California and which other state?
evidence: Raging wildfires in California and Nevada have led to mandatory evacuations of thousands of homes. Authorities warned they may be unable to access roads because of the severe fire conditions.

question_sentence: Which musician will be the headlining act for the Super Bowl LIX halftime show?
evidence: Pulitzer Prize-winning rapper Kendrick Lamar announced that he will headline the Super Bowl LIX halftime show on February 9, 2025.

question_sentence: Who won the Democratic primary for the Delaware governor race in 2024?
What significant milestone could Sarah McBride achieve if elected in the upcoming general election for Delaware’s congressional seat?
choices: She would be the first openly LGBTQ person elected to federal office.
She would be the youngest elected official Delaware has sent to Washington since Joe Biden. .
She would be the first openly transgender person elected to federal office.
She would be the first woman elected to Delaware’s congressional seat

question_sentence: Which two schools have the most athletes transferring in, according to the DIAA?
choices: A.I. du Pont and Delaware Military Academy

question_sentence: Which iconic band, recently inducted into the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame, will perform at Delaware’s 48th annual Grand Gala fundraiser?
What program at the University of Delaware first helped Afghan women who escaped the Taliban to continue their education?
What is the primary reason Big Stone Beach has designated itself as a sanctuary for horseshoe crabs?
choices: To protect the horseshoe crabs from overharvesting
To promote tourism in the area
To create a new recreational area for locals
To conduct scientific research on horseshoe crabs

question_sentence: What was the length of the additional prison sentence given to Danelo Cavalcante after his escape from Chester County Prison?
According to the Mixbook survey, which two locations in Delaware are considered among the 100 most breathtaking views in America?
choices: Bombay Hook National Wildlife Refuge and Fenwick Island
Delaware Seashore State Park and Lewes Beach
Cape Henlopen State Park and Bethany Beach
Brandywine from Rockford Tower and Rehoboth Beach Boardwalk

question_sentence: What significant role did Jackie Pitts play in the development of women’s lacrosse?
choices: She was the first female lacrosse player to be inducted into the National Lacrosse Hall of Fame.
She helped establish the sport’s World Cup and coached the U.S. team to its first championship in 1982.
She was the first woman to play professional lacrosse in the United States.
She founded the first women’s lacrosse team at St. Lawrence University.

question_sentence: What is one of the primary goals of the Delaware Arts Alliance’s CREATE Plan?
choices: Increase the number of art galleries in Delaware
Promote economic activity through development in creative sectors
Reduce the number of cultural events in Delaware
Limit access to arts education for young people
